content: my impression is that the problem of "stream bloat" is not bad except insofar as "streams that users are automatically subscribed to"-bloat is bad. anyone else have thoughts?
Everyone gets notified about new streams, which is a bit more than the average ping level

I think this is an important question and am pleased you raise it, but I am not sure I know the answer. It's different for the "regulars" -- we know what we're doing and can subscribe and unsubscribe to the public streams at will.
I'd like my subscribed stream list to continue fitting on my screen height.
But you can create as many HoTT or program verification streams as you want.
okay, it seems like knowing the answer to this question requires knowing what the new user experience is like and knowing how "too many streams" changes it
I'll try to gather data and/or introspect on this and return results in this thread
I would also like that, but unlike patrick I'm subscribed to everything
I think i am subscribed to everything and just want my pinned streams to fit on my screen height
in the browser version of zulip, when you hover over the name of a stream, there's a little arrow for an options menu
oh, there is yet another kind of attention you can give to streams
which includes "Pin stream <stream name> to the top"
real life attention is divisible (not infinitely, only up to machine precision of neurons), so attention systems should be too :)

:light_bulb: from @Scott Morrison: in order to create a new stream, you should have evidence that a large fraction of active users would prefer not to subscribe to it after learning about its existence
Ha! Here's another stream which I would have liked to know about, but didn't notice until @Jalex Stark just subscribed me. I wondered how everyone suddenly knew about hashtags. :-)
is it worth your time, right now, to browse the list of all streams for 2 minutes?
Not right now, because I need to sleep. :-)
